creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
description: Cubist style; geometricized buildings in LRQ, predominately in salmon pinks, black and browns; blue shapes in UL with geometricized sailboat in tan with white sails at ULC; received unframed
provenance:
The artist (until 1931, sold to Zaks); Zalman Zaks (1931-1945); Nehama (Anna) Zaks, Russia (1945–56); Moisei Zaks, United States (1956–1991/93)[1]; his nephew Leonid Zaks and Elena Zaks, Ramat Gan, Israel (1991/93–2008; consigned to Robert Hiedemann Fine Art, Richmond, Virginia, sold to Mia)

[1] Zaks was reportedly granted permission to export his Russian paintings collection from the Soviet Union in Moscow in December 1956 to January 1957, when he was traveling to Belarus
title: Italian Town by the Sea
